role:system, messaage:There are breast cancer patients where, for each patient, an amount of time has passed since they received surgery and their cancer has either metastasized or not.
Your goal is to be able to predict whether a breast cancer patient will survive given the time since they received surgery and whether their cancer has metastasized.
There are 100, and the time since surgery and status of metastasization are given
by below. 0 or 1 indicates whether the cancer metastasized.

You may check whether a patient is alive by providing a patient ID where the ID ranges from 0 to 99. Make observations by specifying a single integer ID. If the patient is alive, the output will be 0, otherwise 1, if the the patient is dead.
You can think before you choose to decide which ID you want to observe.

Here is an example:
<thought> your thought </thought>
<observe>1</observe>
When asked to answer a question about the environment, respond in the format specified in the question.
<thought> your thought</thought>
<answer> your answer </answer>

Observing similar cases in the data, such as patient 44 with a time of 8.88 and metastasized status = 1, the patient is dead.
